intro: Scorzoneroides autumnalis var. keretina, commonly known as the Keretina autumnal bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing a compact growth habit with hairy leaves. Its botanical features include lanceolate leaves and a short, stout stem that supports its showy floral display.
